thread.title: Super DIRT Week 2015: Kody Swanson wins USAC Silver Crown race for 2nd straight year
thread.title_full: Super DIRT Week 2015: Kody Swanson wins USAC Silver Crown race for 2nd straight year | syracuse.com

author: Special to syracuse.com
title: Super DIRT Week 2015: Kody Swanson wins USAC Silver Crown race for 2nd straight year
text:
By Dick O'Brien
Syracuse, N.Y. â€” Over one hundred years of champ car racing on the Syracuse mile came to a close Saturday afternoon with a 78-mile USAC Silver Crown race.
California native Kody Swanson paced himself early, and made his pass for the lead on the 55th lap and went on to his second straight Super Dirt Week Silver Crown triumph. The victor picked up $10,000 of the $46,000 purse.
Early leader Shane Cockrum held on to second, with Chris Windom in one of Rochester's Fred Gormly cars, and Shane Cottle third and fourth. Local dirt hotshot Stewart Friesen charged from 14th in a second Gormly entry to wind up fifth.
Kody Swanson celebrates after winning the Silver Crown 78 at the New York State Fairgrounds in Geddes, N.Y., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Scott Schild | sschild@syracuse.com Scott Schild | sschild@syracuse.com Filling out the top 10 were A.J. Fike, Jerry Coons Jr., pole sitter Justin Grant, C.J. Leary and Austin Nemire.
Championship dirt cars' long and successful history on the NYS Fairgrounds mile race track began on Sept. 18, 1905.
For years, the same open-wheel champ cars that ran the Indianapolis 500 switched to dirt tires and competed in 100-milers at Syracuse during fair week.
Eleven different Indy 500 winners also won 100-mile races at Syracuse. Included in this group are drivers Al Unser Sr., Roger Ward, Johnnie Parsons and Bob Sweikert.
